page.title: 12HOSPITALS IN CATERHAM PAGE 1
page.content: { ST LAWRENCES HOSPITAL}is for the { {MENTALLY HANDICAPPED.}It was built in 1870. Then it was called "The Caterham Metropolitan Asylum". At that time there were 2000 residents, 200 of them children. Now there are only 1150 residents, only 5 of them children. The hospital is not admitting any more patients so it will eventually close down and many residents will live in the local community. In the hospital there is a building where the residents work. They make toy shoes, paper hats, S.A.S. toy sets and make-up sets. { HORIZON RADIO}is an internal radio service started in 1982. It is operated by a team of volunteers and broadcasts to all wards enabling patients and staff to enjoy music, items of interest and features. Their motto is "Smile with Horizon Radio".
